thread.title: Gord Bamford earns top honours yet again at country music awards
thread.title_full: Gord Bamford earns top honours yet again at country music awards - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Canadian Press
title: Gord Bamford earns top honours yet again at country music awards
text:
HALIFAX - Gord Bamford took home top honours Sunday night as the Canadian Country Music Association handed out the hardware in Halifax for the first time in 33 years.
Bamford, who was born in Australia but calls Alberta home, nabbed three awards including Male Artist of the Year and Songwriter and Single of the Year for his song "Where a Farm Used To Be."
It's the third year in a row Bamford has cleaned up at the awards â€” he won Male Artist of the Year and Single of the Year honours in 2014.
For his first CCMA ever, British Columbia's Dallas Smith took home the coveted Album of the Year award for "Lifted."
Nova Scotia-based Dean Brody won Video of the Year for "Upside Down," while Jess Moskaluke won Female Artist of the Year for the second year in a row.
Veteran vocalist Johnny Ried claimed the fans' choice award for the sixth time in the past seven years.
